**Summary**
• The highly anticipated game "Hollow Knight: Silksong" has led to a surge in demand, causing online gaming stores to experience crashes and error messages.
• This is due to the game's popularity and the long wait for the sequel, resulting in a massive influx of fans attempting to purchase it simultaneously.
• The crashes and error messages are causing frustration among fans eager to buy and play the game.

**Why it matters**
• For users, this means potential delays or difficulties in purchasing and accessing the game, leading to a negative initial experience.
• For developers and online gaming stores, it highlights the need for robust infrastructure and server capacity to handle peak demand during highly anticipated releases.

**Risks**
• Negative user reviews and loss of potential sales if the technical issues persist.

**Opportunities**
• Enhanced server infrastructure and optimized systems for handling high traffic volumes during major game releases.

**Market view**
Market — High demand for "Hollow Knight: Silksong" indicates strong interest in the indie game market.

**Sources**
https://www.wired.com/story/hollow-knight-silksong-is-already-causing-online-gaming-stores-to-crash/
